definition: Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
all/various
surname Zhu
kudzu (Pueraria lobata)/hemp cloth
surname Ge
bright/clear/resonant/to shine/to show/to reveal
a genius in retrospect (idiom); hindsight is 20-20
variant of 三個臭皮匠，賽過一個諸葛亮|三个臭皮匠，赛过一个诸葛亮[san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , sai4 guo4 yi1 ge4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4]
pinyin: san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , sheng4 guo4 yi1 ge4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4
containing_words.word: 三個臭皮匠，勝過一個諸葛亮

definition: lit. three ignorant cobblers add up to a genius (idiom); fig. collective wisdom
pinyin: san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , he2 cheng2 yi1 ge4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4
containing_words.word: 三個臭皮匠，合成一個諸葛亮

definition: lit. three ignorant cobblers add up to a genius (idiom); fig. collective wisdom/wisdom of the masses exceeds that of any individual
pinyin: san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , sai4 guo4 yi1 ge4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4
containing_words.word: 三個臭皮匠，賽過一個諸葛亮

definition: lit. three ignorant cobblers add up to a genius (idiom); fig. collective wisdom/wisdom of the masses exceeds that of any individual
pinyin: san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , sai4 guo4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4
containing_words.word: 三個臭皮匠，賽過諸葛亮

definition: lit. three ignorant cobblers add up to a genius (idiom); fig. collective wisdom/wisdom of the masses exceeds that of any individual
pinyin: san1 ge4 chou4 pi2 jiang5 , ding3 ge4 Zhu1 ge3 Liang4
containing_words.word: 三個臭皮匠，頂個諸葛亮

sentences.english: Zhu Geliang chopped and cut, are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮斬與不斬，都是錯。

sentences.english: Zhuge Liang speculated that the river would be covered by fog in three days, which saved himself later.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮推測三日後江面有霧，他的推測救了自己。

sentences.english: The song was of great importance and benefits to Zhuge Liang's aspiration and achievement in life.
sentences.chinese: 此事於諸葛亮一生之志節與事業，裨益實多。
三個臭皮匠頂個諸葛亮。

sentences.english: GuoLiang Zhou speculated that surface of river has fog and his speculation save himself.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮推測三日後江面有霧，他的推測救了自己。

sentences.english: This is why Zhu Geliang felt remorse for the rest of his…
sentences.chinese: 這也是諸葛亮抱恨終生的底蘊所在。

sentences.english: He thought he was a Zhu Geliang.
He had to make three visits before Zhuge Liang agreed to do so, impressed by his sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮見劉備十分誠懇，終於答應了他的請求。

sentences.english: I found all these databases of this information, although this was after the fact.
sentences.chinese: 我發現了這些信息的數據庫，儘管這有點事後諸葛亮。
但是，當然啦，事後諸葛亮總是好當。

sentences.english: Three cobblers equal Zuge Liang, the mastermind.
sentences.chinese: 三個臭皮匠，頂個諸葛亮。

sentences.english: He is always wise after the event.
His success can't be separated from the nurture and edification of Yimeng Culture.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮的成才離不開沂蒙文化對他的哺育與薰陶。

sentences.english: Three cobblers with their wits combined equal Zhuge Liang, the mastermind.
sentences.chinese: 三個臭皮匠，頂一個諸葛亮。
所有這些顯然都有事後諸葛亮之嫌。

sentences.english: Before he left, Xu Shu recommended Zhuge Liang to the brothers.

definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Sima Yi (179-251), warlord under Cao Cao and subsequently founder of the Jin dynasty
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Three Kingdoms period (220-280) in Chinese history/several Three Kingdoms periods in Korean history, esp. from 1st century AD to unification under Silla 新羅|新罗[Xin1 luo2] in 658
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
skilled manipulator/tactician/strategist/advisor/counsellor

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
high-ranking military officer
